summary: Personal finance web app featuring an advanced budget planner (with charts and actionable finance guidance), expanded quiz content, SEO-focused blog library, and updated UI theming (background + sidebar styling).

existing_features.title: Enhance the Budget Planner experience to be more advanced and realistic by adding additional financial insights and visualizations: include at least one line chart (e.g., cashflow/savings projection over time) and ensure a clear pie chart breakdown is presented; add explicit guidance sections that answer how to improve personal finances with actionable suggestions on saving, investing, and next steps based on the user inputs.

Increase the quiz question library to at least 100 unique finance quiz questions and ensure the app actually uses them (i.e., the quiz initialization and quiz flow should reflect 100+ total questions rather than only a small set). Questions must cover a broad set of personal finance topics, including saving strategies, budgeting methods, investing for beginners, stock market basics, mutual funds, SIP investing, and emergency funds.

new_feature_requests.summary: Enhance budget planner with more advanced/realistic features, including line & pie charts and guidance on saving, investing, and improving personal finances
Increase quiz content from 2 to 100 unique quizzes
Replace all existing blog page content and add 15+ SEO-written personal finance blogs (800+ words each) covering specified real-world problem-solving topics
Update background color theme (purple/violet/blue) to a more creative/advanced look for both private and public pages
Style sidebar as dark with green hover effects

Remove/replace all existing content shown on the Blogs page and publish a new library of at least 15 SEO-focused long-form blog posts (minimum 800+ words each) about personal finance, written to address real-world problems with practical solutions. The set must include posts that cover: Personal finance, Saving strategies, Budgeting methods, Investing for beginners, Stock market basics, Mutual funds, SIP investment, and Emergency funds.

Update the appâ€™s overall background styling to remove the current purple/violet/blue-heavy background look and replace it with a more creative, advanced theme applied consistently across both public pages (unauthenticated) and private/authenticated pages.
Restyle the authenticated app sidebar to be dark and use green hover effects for navigation items, while preserving current navigation structure and active-state clarity.

Resolve the internal contradiction between the current repository requirement that forbids quiz changes and the new request to add 100+ questions by updating the internal requirement documentation so it no longer instructs developers to avoid quiz question additions for this build.

projectName: Advance Budget Planner, expand quizzes to 100, replace blog library with 15+ SEO long-form posts, and refresh theme + sidebar styling
